wikipedia_page.main: George Taylor (February 12, 1803 − August 21, 1891) was a nurseryman from Scotland who emigrated to Kalamazoo, Michigan in 1855. There, he became known as George "Celery" Taylor because he introduced commercial celery growing to the United States.

response: George Taylor may refer to:

Local nurseryman George Taylor was born at Hounam Grange in 1803.George "Celery" Taylor, www.morebattle.bordernet.co.uk, retrieved 8 May 2014 He emigrated to Kalamazoo, Michigan in 1855, and became known as George "Celery" Taylor because he introduced commercial celery growing to the United States.
